Resources & Equipment

The NeuroXR Collaborative has the equipment, knowledge, and experience, paired with ample physical and intellectual resources to develop novel XR technology with academic and community partners. To meet collaborator needs, we can develop novel, interactive VR scenes, with voices and actions recorded and animated in our facilities, virtual environments designed and created by SOIC students, and programmed with the latest game engines. Our augmented reality development teams allow users to combine the real world with computer-generated content across multiple sensory modalities.
